headline: Disney Expects a New CEO in ‘Early 2026.’ Why It’s a Make-or-Break Call for the Stock.
summary: Disney  remains on course to appoint a new CEO early this year.  It’s a challenging job, with one of the new boss’s top priorities likely to be ending a decade-long stagnant run for the House of Mouse’s shares.  Chairman of the board James Gorman said in a letter to shareholders late Thursday that Disney expects “to announce the appointment of the Company’s next CEO in early 2026.”

headline: Netflix says Paramount bid 'doesn't pass sniff test' as Warner battle intensifies, FT reports
summary: Netflix co-chief executive Greg Peters said the company is on track to win the ​backing of Warner Bros Discovery shareholders for its $82.7 ‌billion offer for the company's film and television studios, adding that Paramount's rival ‌bid "doesn't pass the sniff test", the Financial Times reported on Friday.  In an interview with the FT, Peters said only a "very small" number of WBD shares had been tendered in support ⁠of Paramount's hostile $108 ‌billion offer for the entire company.  Netflix, Warner Brothers and Paramount Skydance didn't immediately respond to Reuters ‍requests for comment outside regular business hours.

raw.headline: Netflix says Paramount bid 'doesn't pass sniff test' as Warner battle intensifies, FT reports
raw.summary: Netflix co-chief executive Greg Peters said the company is on track to win the ​backing of Warner Bros Discovery shareholders for its $82.7 ‌billion offer for the company's film and television studios, adding that Paramount's rival ‌bid "doesn't pass the sniff test", the Financial Times reported on Friday.  In an interview with the FT, Peters said only a "very small" number of WBD shares had been tendered in support ⁠of Paramount's hostile $108 ‌billion offer for the entire company.  Netflix, Warner Brothers and Paramount Skydance didn't immediately respond to Reuters ‍requests for comment outside regular business hours.
